intro: Pedicularis stylosa, commonly known as the purple monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its vibrant purple to red flowers, which are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
